item.title: Shillong Teer Results Today, January 2, 2024 LIVE: Winning Numbers For Shillong Teer, Morning Teer, Juwai T - News18
item.description:
Shillong Teer Results Today, January 2, 2024 LIVE: Winning Numbers For Shillong Teer, Morning Teer, Juwai Teer

Date: January 02, 2025, Source: News18

The Shillong Teer lottery, hosted daily at Shillong Polo Stadium by the Khasi Hills Archery Sports Association, presents players with opportunities to win significant cash prizes while promoting youth archery.

Winning Numbers for January 2, 2025

  • Shillong Teer First Round Winning Number: 64
  • Shillong Teer Second Round Winning Number: 92
  • Khanapara Teer First Round Winning Number: 95
  • Khanapara Teer Second Round Winning Number: 74
  • Juwai Teer First Round Winning Number: 31
  • Juwai Teer Second Round Winning Number: 42
  • Shillong Morning Teer First Round Winning Number: 74
  • Shillong Morning Teer Second Round Winning Number: 54

How to Play Shillong Lottery?

  • Players choose a number between 0 and 99.
  • Correct guesses win cash prizes, with payouts depending on the amount wagered.

For further details and updates, participants may visit the official KHASA website.

item.title: 'Kya bol rahe hain?': Bihar CM Nitish Kumar reacts to Lalu's INDIA bloc invite - The Times of India
item.description:
'Kya bol rahe hain?': Bihar CM Nitish Kumar reacts to Lalu's INDIA bloc invite

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Bihar News

Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar has responded to Lalu Prasad Yadav's invitation for the INDIA bloc, expressing his thoughts on the alliance's prospects.

  • Nitish Kumar questions the intentions behind the INDIA bloc invite.
  • He emphasizes the necessity for unity and cooperation among opposition parties.
  • The Chief Minister urges for a collective strategy to challenge current political dynamics.
"We need to focus on working together for the greater good of the people." - Nitish Kumar

This statement comes as political tensions rise and opposition parties seek a unified front ahead of upcoming elections.

item.title: How many judges' children have been made seniors? Supreme Court slams lawyer for nepotism claim - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
How many judges' children have been made seniors? Supreme Court slams lawyer for nepotism claim

Publication Date: Thursday, Source: Bar and Bench

The Supreme Court addressed allegations made by a lawyer regarding nepotism in the designation of Senior Advocates. The court questioned the validity of claims against judges' relatives being appointed as Senior Advocates.

  • The Supreme Court criticized a lawyer insinuating nepotism among Senior Advocate designations.
  • Justice Gavai asked the lawyer how many judges' children had been made seniors.
  • The court warned the lawyer of potential consequences for failing to substantiate claims.
  • The designation of 70 lawyers by Delhi High Court has faced scrutiny and controversy.
  • One member of the Permanent Committee resigned over the alleged lack of consent in the final list preparation.
“This is a court of law and not azaad maidan of Bombay to make speeches. Make legal arguments and not for gallery.” - Justice BR Gavai

The Supreme Court provided time for the lawyer to reconsider the allegations made in the petition, highlighting the seriousness of the matter.

item.title: Farmers' Protests | 'Why Can't Centre Make A Statement That Their Doors Are Open For Farmers?' Supreme... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Addresses Farmers' Protests and Government's Response

Date: January 2, 2024 | Source: LiveLaw

The Supreme Court heard a petition regarding ongoing farmers' protests, questioning the Union Government's willingness to address farmer grievances, particularly the demand for a statutory guarantee of Minimum Support Price.

  • The petition was filed by Guninder Kaur Gill, addressing issues raised during the farmers' protests.
  • Solicitor General Tushar Mehta admitted to having 'no knowledge' about the petition.
  • Justice Bhuyan challenged the government to declare its openness to considering farmers' grievances.
  • Justice Kant suggested utilizing a High-Powered Committee to facilitate discussions between the government and farmers.
  • The Court instructed that a copy of the petition be provided to the Union counsel for instructions within 10 days.
“Why can’t the Central Government also make a statement that their doors are open for the farmers?” – Justice Bhuyan

In summary, the Court is pushing for transparency and communication from the government in dealing with pressing farmer issues.

item.title: Supreme Court to hear plea by Asaduddin Owaisi to implement Places of Worship Act - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court to Hear Plea by Asaduddin Owaisi to Implement Places of Worship Act

Published on: 02 Jan 2025, 8:14 am

The Supreme Court agreed to hear a plea by AIMIM leader Asaduddin Owaisi regarding the implementation of the Places of Worship (Special Provisions) Act of 1991.

  • Owaisi's petition seeks the enforcement of the Act, which protects the religious character of places of worship as of August 15, 1947.
  • The plea has been tagged with another petition by Jamiat Ulema-e-Hind.
  • The matter is expected to be heard in February.
  • In December 2024, the Supreme Court ordered trial courts to avoid issuing orders or conducting surveys about existing religious structures in related cases.
“The Act explicitly prohibits the filing of such suits.”

This development emphasizes ongoing legal debates concerning the religious and historical status of places of worship in India, potentially affecting numerous cases across the nation.

item.title: Adani Group bribery allegations: Chandrababu Naidu takes a step back, says no action can be taken until c - The Times of India
item.description:
Adani Group bribery allegations: Chandrababu Naidu takes a step back, says no action can be taken until concrete proof

Publication Date: [Not Specified] Source: [Not Specified]

Chandrababu Naidu has stated that no action can be taken regarding the bribery allegations against the Adani Group until there is concrete proof. This response highlights the political implications of the allegations and the importance of evidence in such serious claims.

  • Chandrababu Naidu's position on the Adani Group bribery allegations.
  • The need for concrete proof before taking any action.
  • The implications of these allegations on political dynamics.
No action can be taken until concrete proof is presented.

This situation underscores the importance of evidence in political allegations and the potential impact on public trust in political figures.

item.title: Bangladesh court rejects bail plea of Chinmoy Krishna Das - The Hindu
item.description:
Bangladesh Court Denies Bail to Chinmoy Krishna Das Amid Protests

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: The Daily Star

The court in Chattogram has refused to grant bail to Chinmoy Krishna Das, following a hearing with heightened security. This decision comes after significant protests and violence related to his case.

  • The bail request was denied by Judge Md. Saiful Islam after a 30-minute hearing.
  • Chinmoy Krishna Das is facing sedition charges for allegedly raising a saffron flag above the national flag.
  • The protests following his arrest led to violent clashes and the death of a lawyer.
“We will move for Chinmoy in the court for his bail.” – Apurba Kumar Bhattacharjee, lawyer

The ongoing unrest reflects deeper societal tensions and legal challenges within Bangladesh, highlighting the implications of the case on public order and legal proceedings.

item.title: Anand Teltumbde moves Bombay High Court for discharge from Bhima Koregaon case - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Anand Teltumbde Seeks Discharge in Bhima Koregaon Case from Bombay High Court

Published on: 02 Jan 2025, 7:30 am

Dalit rights activist Anand Teltumbde has approached the Bombay High Court seeking closure of the case against him for his alleged role in the Bhima Koregaon violence of 2018.

  • Teltumbde's plea follows a rejection by a special National Investigation Agency (NIA) court in May 2024.
  • The case against him alleges he was a convenor of the Elgar Parishad event that led to the riots.
  • Justice Sarang Kotwal recused himself from the hearing, citing past involvement in bail pleas.
  • Teltumbde is currently out on bail, with previous bail pleas being rejected due to alleged affiliations with a banned organization.
  • The Bombay High Court initially granted him bail in November 2022, which was upheld by the Supreme Court.

“Judicial propriety demands that it should be heard by a different bench,” Justice Kotwal stated regarding his recusal.

The ongoing case has significant implications for freedom of speech and dissent in India.

item.title: Farmers Protest | 'Your Attitude Is There Should Be No Reconciliation' : Supreme Court Pulls Up Punjab Govt For Not Shifting Dallewal To Hospital - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Supreme Court Urges Punjab Government to Provide Medical Aid to Hunger Striking Farmer Leader

Publication Date: January 2, 2024 | Source: Live Law

The Supreme Court expressed dissatisfaction with the Punjab Government for not taking action to shift farmers' leader Jagjit Singh Dallewal to a hospital while he continues his hunger strike.

  • The Court clarified that shifting Dallewal does not mean he must stop his protest.
  • Justice Surya Kant stated that Dallewal's health must be prioritized while allowing his hunger strike to continue.
  • The Punjab Advocate General advised that Dallewal would accept medical help only if the Centre engages in talks.
  • The Court emphasized that irresponsible media portrayals misinterpret its intentions to compel Dallewal to end his fast.
  • The situation involves Dallewal's demands for a statutory guarantee for the Minimum Support Price for crops.
“Your attitude is that there should be no reconciliation. That is the whole problem.” - Justice Surya Kant

The Court has scheduled the next hearing for Monday, addressing Dallewal's broader issues related to farmers' protests.

item.title: Two WDs set to bring moderate to heavy snowfall in J&K from Jan 4-5: MeT - Greater Kashmir
item.description:
Two WDs set to bring moderate to heavy snowfall in J&K from Jan 4-5: MeT

Date: January 2 | Source: Greater Kashmir

The Meteorological Centre Srinagar has forecasted intermittent light, moderate, and heavy snowfall in Jammu and Kashmir through January 6, with peak activity expected from January 4 night till January 6 morning.

  • Two western disturbances are expected to impact J&K from January 4 to 6.
  • Peak snowfall activity anticipated overnight from January 4 to January 6.
  • Moderate rain forecasted for the plains with snow in most areas.
  • Heavy snow possible at isolated higher reaches during January 4 night to January 5 late night.
  • Advisories recommended for tourists and travelers due to icy road conditions.

The weather is expected to improve from January 6 afternoon, with drier conditions forecasted from January 7 to 10.

item.title: SC considers Owaisi's plea seeking to maintain 1991 places of worship law - The Times of India
item.description:
SC considers Owaisi's plea seeking to maintain 1991 places of worship law

Date: Not specified
Source: Times of India

The Supreme Court is examining the plea put forth by Asaduddin Owaisi, which seeks to uphold the 1991 places of worship law that preserves the religious character of places of worship as they were on August 15, 1947.

  • The law aims to maintain the status quo of religious places in India.
  • Owaisi argues that the law is crucial for protecting communal harmony in the country.
  • There has been ongoing debate regarding the implications of this law on communal relations.
"Maintaining the status quo is necessary for peace and unity among different religious communities in India." - Asaduddin Owaisi

The outcome of this case could significantly impact India's approach to religious disputes and the management of places of worship.

item.title: Anna University sexual assault case being politicised without genuine concern, says Madras HC Judge - The Hindu
item.description:
Madras HC Judge Critiques Political Response to Anna University Sexual Assault Case

Publication Date: January 02, 2025 11:41 am IST

Source: The Hindu

Justice P. Velmurugan of the Madras High Court expressed deep concern over the politicization of the Anna University sexual assault case, highlighting societal indifference towards women's rights and criticizing the lack of genuine concerns from political parties.

  • The Judge emphasized that the incident should serve as a wake-up call to society.
  • Political protests were seen as attempts to gain media attention rather than authentic concern.
  • Justice Velmurugan criticized the media for conducting a 'media trial' rather than responsible reporting.
  • He condemned the mindset of viewing women as needing 'protection,' advocating for gender equality.
  • An all-woman IPS officers’ team has been formed to investigate the case.
“I’m ashamed to live in this era when discrimination based on gender, caste, and so on continues.” - Justice P. Velmurugan

In conclusion, the Judge called for collective shame in the face of ongoing gender discrimination and underscored the need for real change in societal attitudes towards women.

item.title: Setback for Hindu monk Chinmoy Krishna Das as Bangladesh court rejects bail plea - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Bangladesh Court Denies Bail to Hindu Monk Chinmoy Krishna Das

Date: January 02, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

A Chattogram court in Bangladesh has denied bail to Chinmoy Krishna Das, a former ISKCON monk, during a tightly secured hearing.

  • The court hearing lasted about 30 minutes with arguments presented by both sides.
  • A team of 11 Supreme Court lawyers represented Chinmoy Krishna Das.
  • His bail plea was rejected by Metropolitan Sessions judge Md Saiful Islam.
  • Chinmoy faces sedition charges for allegedly raising a saffron flag above Bangladesh's national flag.
  • His arrest on November 25 led to protests and clashes resulting in a lawyer's death.
  • Additional arrests of fellow monks occurred amid the unrest.
  • The Indian government expressed concern over the situation in Bangladesh.
“We will move for Chinmoy in the court for his bail.” - Lawyer Apurba Kumar Bhattacharjee

The decision by the Chattogram court highlights ongoing tensions in Bangladesh regarding minority rights and protests against extremism.

item.title: Uma Thomas accident: Footage showing Kerala MLA falling from stage exposes flagrant violation of safety norms - The Hindu
item.description:
Uma Thomas accident: Footage showing Kerala MLA falling from stage exposes flagrant violation of safety norms

Published on: January 02, 2025 11:31 am IST

Source: The Hindu

A video has surfaced showing Kerala MLA Uma Thomas falling from a makeshift stage, highlighting serious safety violations. She is currently on ventilator support after the incident which occurred during a mass dance event at Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium.

  • Footage reveals a lack of adequate space and support on the stage.
  • Authorities have identified unsafe stage construction, including a notable tilt.
  • The police have registered a case against the event organizers for negligence.
  • The Kochi Corporation has suspended a health inspector for overlooking safety norms.
"The Kochi City police had already found flagrant violation of safety norms in the way the stage was set up."

This incident has raised questions about the safety measures at public events and has prompted calls for stricter regulations.

item.title: BCI moves Supreme Court for increase in enrolment fee, highlights financial crunch - Bar & Bench - Indian Legal News
item.description:
BCI Seeks Supreme Court's Approval for Higher Enrolment Fees Due to Financial Strain

Published on: 02 Jan 2025, 5:53 am

The Bar Council of India (BCI) has approached the Supreme Court to request an increase in enrolment fees for lawyers due to financial difficulties faced by State Bar Councils.

  • The BCI filed an application to amend the Advocates Act, 1961.
  • Current enrolment fees are limited to ₹750 for general candidates and ₹125 for SC/ST candidates.
  • The last fee revision occurred in 1993; BCI cites inflation as a significant issue.
  • BCI argues that without increased fees, Bar Councils may struggle to maintain operations and pay staff.
  • The proposed fees include ₹25,000 for general candidates and ₹10,000 for SC/ST candidates.
“It is also an admitted fact that if the State Bar Councils are restrained from charging anything more than Rs.600/- today; naturally the Bar Councils and the Bar Council of India would die their own death; their survival would not only be difficult rather impossible.”

The BCI emphasizes the need for fee adjustments reflective of current economic conditions to ensure the viability of legal support institutions.

item.title: Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar sworn in as Kerala Governor - The Hindu
item.description:
Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar Sworn in as Kerala Governor

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: The Hindu

Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar was sworn in as the Governor of Kerala on January 2, 2025, at a brief ceremony officiated by Kerala High Court Chief Justice Nitin Madhukar Jamdar.

  • Mr. Arlekar is the 23rd Governor of Kerala, succeeding Arif Mohammed Khan.
  • The ceremony was attended by significant political figures, including Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan.
  • Mr. Arlekar previously served as the Governor of Bihar and Himachal Pradesh.
  • He has a political background as a member of the RSS and the BJP.
“His term is anticipated with interest due to the previous tensions between the governor's office and the state government.”

In conclusion, Mr. Arlekar’s appointment represents a new chapter in Kerala's governance as he steps into a role marked by a complicated relationship with the local administration.

item.title: ‘AAP Govt should rise above party politics, take decisions in farmers’ interest’: Shivraj writes to Atishi - The Indian Express
item.description:
‘Stop playing politics with farmers’ welfare’: Shivraj Chouhan to Delhi CM Atishi

Publication Date: January 1, 2025 Source: The Indian Express

Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan has criticized the AAP government for failing to implement central schemes benefiting farmers and emphasized the need for political unity in addressing farmers' issues.

  • Chouhan expressed concerns about the indifference of the AAP government towards farmers.
  • He criticized former chief minister Arvind Kejriwal for prioritizing political gain over farmers' welfare.
  • Chouhan highlighted the non-implementation of important agricultural schemes in Delhi.
  • His letter comes ahead of the upcoming Delhi Assembly elections.
“Political competition should not become an obstacle to farmers’ welfare. Farmers’ welfare is the duty of all governments.” - Shivraj Singh Chouhan

Chouhan's appeal emphasizes the importance of prioritizing the needs of farmers above political interests as elections approach.

item.title: Husband Can't Claim Ownership Of Wife's Body, Privacy, Her Consent Paramount; Sharing Intimate Acts'... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Husband Can't Claim Ownership Of Wife's Body, Privacy, Her Consent Paramount

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Allahabad High Court Judgement

The Allahabad High Court has ruled that a wife's body, privacy, and rights are her own and should not be subject to her husband's control. This landmark decision emphasizes the importance of consent in intimate relationships.

  • The Court highlighted that husbands must respect their wives' autonomy and privacy.
  • A husband's attempt to share intimate videos without consent is a violation of trust and privacy.
  • Justice Vinod Diwakar stressed that a wife is a separate individual with her own rights.
  • The ruling addressed a case involving the unauthorized sharing of intimate videos by a husband.
  • The Court referred to key principles from the Indian Constitution regarding privacy and bodily autonomy.
“The wife's body is her own property, and her consent remains paramount in all aspects of her personal and intimate life...”

The ruling marks a significant step in recognizing women's rights within marriage and reaffirming the legal protections surrounding personal privacy.

item.title: Places of worship law: SC agrees to hear AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi’s plea on February 17 - The Hindu
item.description:
Supreme Court to Hear Asaduddin Owaisi's Plea on Places of Worship Law

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Supreme Court has agreed to hear a plea from AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi regarding the implementation of the 1991 places of worship law, which aims to maintain the religious status of places of worship as they existed on August 15, 1947. The case is set to be discussed on February 17.

  • The Supreme Court agreed to tag Owaisi's plea with other pending cases regarding the 1991 law.
  • The law prohibits changing the religious character of places of worship established before August 15, 1947.
  • Owaisi's petition seeks to compel the Centre to ensure effective implementation of the law.
  • Challenges to the law include a batch of petitions that have previously been filed.
“We will tag this,” said Chief Justice Sanjiv Khanna.

This development indicates ongoing legal discourse surrounding the protection of religious sites in India and the implications of the 1991 law.

item.title: Places of worship law: SC to hear AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi’s plea - The Hindu
item.description:
Supreme Court to Hear Owaisi's Plea on Places of Worship Law

Date: January 02, 2025 Source: The Hindu

The Supreme Court has agreed to consider the plea of AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi regarding the implementation of the 1991 places of worship law aimed at maintaining the religious character of places as they existed on August 15, 1947.

  • The Court will tag Owaisi's plea with pending cases on February 17, 2025.
  • AIMIM's plea follows a prior order restraining courts from hearing new suits on reclaiming religious places.
  • The 1991 law prohibits the conversion of places of worship.
  • Owaisi's plea seeks effective enforcement of the law amid concerns over court-ordered surveys of mosques.
“We will tag this,” the CJI said regarding the plea.

Owaisi's call for action reflects ongoing tensions surrounding religious site claims in India, emphasizing the need for legal clarity and enforcement of existing regulations.

item.title: Supreme Court to hear AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi's plea on places of worship law - The Hindu
item.description:
Supreme Court to Hear Asaduddin Owaisi's Plea on Places of Worship Law

Date: January 02, 2025
Source: The Hindu

The Supreme Court is set to hear AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi's plea regarding the 1991 places of worship law, which mandates maintaining the religious character of places as they were on August 15, 1947. The hearing follows a recent Supreme Court ruling that halted fresh litigations against the law.

  • Owaisi filed his plea on December 17, 2024, through advocate Fuzail Ahmad Ayyubi.
  • The 1991 law prohibits changing the religious character of places of worship as they existed in 1947.
  • A recent Supreme Court order restrained courts from taking on new suits regarding the religious character of several mosques.
  • Cases concerning various religious sites, including Gyanvapi, Shahi Idgah, and Shahi Jama Masjid, have been stalled pending the court's review.
  • The Muslim side has filed pleas for the law's strict enforcement to maintain communal peace.
“The petitions challenging the law were filed with 'mischievous intent' to facilitate lawsuits against these religious sites.”

This upcoming hearing may tag Owaisi's plea with existing cases regarding the law's implementation and its implications for communal harmony.
